title: Operations Manager
description:
Fulkrum is a global leader in inspection, expediting, auditing, and technical staffing services, delivering exceptional solutions to the energy, engineering, and construction industries for over 14 years. Headquartered in the UK, we have established a strong presence across six continents, serving more than 300 clients worldwide.



Our commitment to excellence has been recognised with prestigious awards, including the King's Award for Enterprise in International Trade (2023\), the People and Competency Award at the EIC Awards (2023\), and the Scale\-Up Award at the WESCA North America Awards (2024\). Most recently, Fulkrum was named the 2025 winner in the People, Culture \& Optimisation category at the EIC North \& Central America Regional Awards.

  



Our Brazil Office is currently seeking a highly motivated and experienced Operations Manager to join our dynamic team.

 **Main Responsibilities (include but are not limited to):**


**Operational Leadership**


* Efficiency and Compliance: Guide the team in operational excellence through regular training and adherence to work instructions, ensuring timely responses, accurate reporting, and proper use of the IRIS system, Integrated Management System, and all company policies, processes, and procedures. Overall responsibility for leadership and support, which enables the team and Region to meet and surpass KPIs and Quality Metrics.
* Training and Development: Conduct initial and ongoing training for QC Coordinators (QCCs), maintaining minimal errors and supporting development. Ensure the gap analysis assessment is completed for all new starters and, as needed, for experienced coordinators.
* IRIS Compliance: Oversee IRIS accuracy and compliance for the Region, ensuring client and inspector profiles, rates, assignments, and reports are up\-to\-date and meet Fulkrum standards. Operations Managers should become “super\-users” of IRIS, driving continuous improvements throughout the team and the business.
* Financial Oversight: Improve cash flow and reduce the Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC) by supporting Accounts and managing invoicing challenges between departments, reducing errors and minimising un\-invoiced visits, ensuring POs and approvals are received on time, supporting credit control escalations, and reporting issues promptly and consistently to Senior Management. Identify areas for improvement between coordination and accounts, suggest process improvements, draft Corrective Action Reports (CARs), and support cash flow and credit control objectives.
* Budget Management: Support the Regional Manager in budget maintenance, report on client activity levels, and drive financial efficiencies. Monitor and manage office expenses and personnel utilisation. Recommend improvements to the Regional Manager.
* Gross Profit Targets: Ensure gross profit objectives by overseeing client and inspector negotiations, minimising reliance on agencies, and upholding service standards.
* Growth and Client Engagement: Collaborate with Sales to highlight Fulkrum’s capabilities and successes, recommend growth opportunities, and support the acquisition of new clients and service lines. Present IRIS and Fulkrum’s strengths in client meetings to support business development.
* Client Retention: Schedule reviews with key clients, addressing service quality and identifying any gaps for improvement. Maintain client relationships through regular communication and promptly address any issues to ensure satisfaction. Report concerns to the Regional Manager as needed.
* CRM and Reporting: Document client interactions in Salesforce, compile monthly reports, and highlight successes, challenges, and key client insights for the Regional Manager.
* Overhead Management: Regularly assess team workloads to maintain operational efficiencies, minimise redundancies, and support overhead budget goals. Propose staffing adjustments to the Regional Manager as required.

  


**Team Development**


* Recruitment and Onboarding: Collaborate with HR to recruit and onboard new team members, ensuring resources and support are ready for a smooth start.
* Performance and Probation Management: Lead 30\-, 60\-, and 90\-day reviews for new hires, ensuring development aligns with company standards. Conduct regular performance evaluations and address skill gaps through targeted training.

  


**Compliance \& QHSE**


* Process Optimisation: Act as a “process expert” within Fulkrum, supporting the Integrated Management System (IMS) and continuous process improvements. Collaborate on IRIS developments and provide training for each improvement.
* Focal Point: for QHSE and Compliance during internal/external audits, draft and implement CARs as necessary, support all IMS initiatives for process improvements.

  


**Commercial**


* Proposal and Contract Support: Support bid preparation, draft project\-specific execution plans and procedures, create/approve rate sheets, perform contract renewals, and support all other commercial requirements as needed.
* Insurance and Compliance: Coordinate insurance documents, bank letters, and tax documentation, ensuring sufficient coverage for client projects.

  


**Team Culture and Engagement**


* Team Building: Foster a positive and inclusive office culture, organising team events and maintaining a supportive environment. Promote retention through effective leadership and engagement initiatives.
* Engagement: Drive any engagement survey initiatives and follow up on global, regional and local actions to ensure continuous engagement of the team.

  


**Client Account Management**


* Client Service Reviews: Schedule meetings with key clients to evaluate service quality and implement corrective actions as necessary.
* Business Development Support: Assist the Regional Manager and Key Account Managers in bidding, negotiating contracts, presenting to prospective clients, and identifying new business opportunities.
* Growth and Forecasting: Monitor project forecasts, ensure proper onboarding of new clients, and communicate budget impacts to the Regional Manager and Finance Department.

  


**Coordination Responsibilities**


* Client Support: Manage client requests for QA/QC, Engineering, and Project Support, ensuring prompt and accurate fulfilment.
* Candidate Management: Source candidates, prepare them for interviews, and coordinate their placement, handling contractual and performance\-related concerns throughout their assignments.
* Service Level Agreements: Ensure adherence to all client SLAs and Fulkrum KPIs, negotiating inspector rates to support office margins.

  


**Qualifications and Skills**


* Minimum 10 years of industry experience, with 5 years in a leadership role.
* Extensive knowledge of oil and gas projects, both onshore and offshore.
* Proficient in MS Office; CRM experience preferred.
* Demonstrated client relationship management skills, with the ability to thrive in fast\-paced environments.

  


**Personal Attributes**


* Highly organised, process\-oriented, and capable of multitasking.
* Strong leadership skills with a proven ability to motivate and guide teams.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Willingness to support personnel and clients outside of standard hours as necessary.

  


**Additional Information:**



This is a pivotal role within the organisation, requiring exceptional interpersonal skills, keen attention to detail, and a comprehensive understanding of the oil and gas industry. The ideal candidate will be a strong team leader who consistently delivers the highest standards of service to clients. Candidates with a background in the coordination or management of large projects, a thorough knowledge of Fulkrum’s coordination and accounts processes, and a proven ability to build and nurture client relationships will excel in this position. This individual will inspire their team to meet and exceed company goals, driving both performance and growth.

  


**Travel**



Travel will frequently be required throughout the Region.

 **HSE Awareness:**



All personnel are informed of Fulkrum’s Health and Safety policy and procedures during the onboarding process. Any HSE incidents must be reported and logged with the QHSE Manager, who will oversee and support any subsequent investigations.

  


**Why Join Us?**



This is an exciting opportunity for a driven Operations Manager to showcase their expertise in a supportive and collaborative environment. At Fulkrum, you’ll make a tangible impact while advancing your career in the thriving global business sector.

  

We offer a fantastic working environment with a highly engaged team and consistently high eNPS scores. Fulkrum's success in attracting new clients and expanding our global footprint is a testament to our excellence and dedication. We have regular reward and recognition initiatives, a social budget, and a refer\-a\-friend scheme to ensure our team feels valued and motivated.

  

Join us to be part of a high\-performing team with ample opportunities for skill enhancement and development. Be a part of our success story and contribute to our continued growth and innovation.

  


**Apply now** and become a valued part of our growing team!

  



Fulkrum

title: Software Tester Engineer Sênior (PIX)
description:
**Nosso time de Tecnologia** 




 Muito mais do que código e sistemas — é o meio essencial que torna possível o nosso modelo único, que combina o melhor do digital com a presença física e humana. Aqui, tecnologia não é um fim em si mesma, mas a ponte entre inovação e a experiência real do cliente. Atuam lado a lado com as áreas de negócio para garantir soluções robustas, escaláveis e centradas nas pessoas, sem abrir mão de um olhar técnico e científico aprofundado em frentes como desenvolvimento de software, infraestrutura, cibersegurança e arquitetura. É nessa interseção entre propósito, técnica e impacto que constroem o presente e futuro.
 



  





**Seus desafios para crescer na jornada** 



* Realizar testes funcionais e regressivos para assegurar qualidade e estabilidade nas entregas;
* Analisar requisitos e elaborar cenários de teste para prevenir falhas;
* Reportar bugs de forma estruturada e utilizar ferramentas de gestão como Jira para uma comunicação clara e rastreabilidade;

**O que você precisa para se tornar um Agilizado?** 




**Requisitos** 




  




* Técnicas de testes funcionais, regressivos e exploratórios.
* Ferramentas de gerenciamento de tarefas e bugs: Jira, Trello.

*

* CTFL (Certified Tester Foundation Level – ISTQB);

 *de cashback* 
 sobre o valor total da fatura do cartão revertido em crédito na fatura seguinte.

title: Team Lead, API Integration Engineer
description:
* 


Join ABC Fitness, the leading technology provider for the fitness industry!
Job Description
Join ABC Fitness and become part of a culture that’s as ambitious as it is authentic. Let’s transform the future of fitness—together!
Our Values
Best Life
We believe great work begins with great people. That’s why our culture is built on respect, trust, and belonging. We create an inclusive environment where every team member can bring their authentic self to work—because diverse perspectives drive innovation and meaningful impact.  

Growth Mindset
We are doers, thinkers, and dreamers. At ABC Fitness, your growth is our investment. Through continuous learning, mentorship, and professional development opportunities, we empower you to reach new heights—personally and professionally.  

One Team
From day one, you’ll be part of a team that collaborates, celebrates, and cares. We move fast, support one another, and have fun along the way. Because when you thrive, we all thrive.
The Team Lead, API Integration Engineer will provide technical leadership and strategic guidance for ABC Fitness Solutions’ API Integrations team. This role will drive the design, development, and optimization of integrations across ABC’s product ecosystem, including Glofox, Ignite, Trainerize, Commerce, and Gymsales. The Lead Engineer will work closely with cross\-functional teams, external partners, and global customers to ensure seamless, scalable, and secure integration experiences. The Lead Engineer will also be an advocate for standards and drive adoption of industry standard practices across the entire ABC ecosystem.  

Key Responsibilities* Lead and mentor a team of API Integration Engineers, fostering collaboration, professional growth, and technical excellence.
* Architect, develop, and maintain API\- and Webhook\-based integrations across ABC’s platforms and third\-party systems, ensuring performance, reliability, and scalability.
* Serve as the escalation point for complex integration issues and provide expert technical guidance to internal and external stakeholders
* Collaborate with global customers and integration partners to deliver robust API and Webhook solutions tailored to their business needs.
* Oversee the implementation and maintenance of authentication protocols and secure data transfer mechanisms (OAuth 2\.0, JWT, API keys, Webhook signing/validation).
* Evaluate and introduce new tools and processes for API and Webhook testing, automation, and monitoring to enhance efficiency and quality.
* Partner with Product and Platform Engineering teams to identify API and Webhook enhancements, define integration roadmaps, and influence strategic initiatives.
* Ensure documentation, best practices, and technical standards are maintained and shared across the team.
* Champion continuous improvement initiatives, driving innovation within the API and Webhook ecosystems.
* Represent the API Integration team in cross\-departmental meetings and technical planning sessions.
  

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
* 7–10 years of experience in API and Webhook development, integration, or platform engineering roles, including at least 2 years in a leadership capacity.
* Advanced understanding of RESTful APIs, Webhook architectures, authentication protocols, and error handling best practices.
* Strong experience using API testing and automation tools (Postman, Newman, or similar frameworks).
* Demonstrated success in managing customer\-facing API and Webhook integrations with global clients or enterprise systems.
* Familiarity with modern integration and event\-driven technologies such as Kafka, AWS SNS/SQS, and API management tools (Gravitee, Kong, Apigee, or AWS API Gateway).
* Chargebee or similar SaaS billing integration experience preferred.
* Proven leadership skills with the ability to coach and motivate engineers across multiple geographies.
* Excellent written and spoken English skills with the ability to communicate technical concepts clearly to both technical and non\-technical audiences. Strong problem\-solving, analytical, and decision\-making skills.
  

Core Competencies (Aligned with ABC Values)
One Team* Leads collaboration efforts across global engineering, product, and customer success teams.
* Fosters a culture of inclusivity, transparency, and partnership across regions and functions.

Growth Mindset* Demonstrates curiosity and continuous improvement by championing innovation in integration technology and practices.
* Mentors others to embrace experimentation and learning from challenges to drive excellence.

Best Life* Promotes balance, well\-being, and respect within the team.
* Leads with empathy and integrity, ensuring a supportive and healthy work environment.
  

Supervisory Responsibility* This role leads a small team of API Integration Engineers and may oversee contractors or partner technical contributors as needed.
  

Additional Information* Occasional flexible working hours required to support global integration partners and customers.
* Expected to collaborate frequently across multiple time zones.
* This role operates within ABC’s global remote\-first framework.


WHAT WE OFFER YOU:
A purpose\-driven company, committed to helping change people’s lives through technology, with a value\-driven culture focused on Better Life (\#bestlife), One Team (\#oneteam), and Growth Mindset (\#growthmindset).* Home office subsidy – you might need help with your internet bills;
* Disconnect Days – once per quarter, we take a collective break and enjoy a day off together around the world. \#oneteam
* Free access to LinkedIn Learning;
* Partnership with Dell and Microsoft Office (up to 30% discount on PCs, electronics, and accessories);
* Partnerships with universities: Mackenzie, FIAP, and Fundação Vanzolini;
* EAP – we offer psychological, legal, and financial assistance whenever you need it;
* Health and Dental Insurance
* Inclusion in the corporate life insurance, at no additional cost.


At ABC Fitness, we don’t just build technology—we build communities and transform lives. Your work matters here, your growth is supported, and your voice is heard. We welcome diverse talent and encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet every requirement.  

ABC’S COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, EQUALITY, BELONGING AND INCLUSION:  

ABC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We strive to create a workplace where every employee, client, and partner feels valued, inspired, and empowered to reach their full potential. For us, inclusion isn’t just the right thing to do—it’s a business imperative. Learn more at abcfitness.com.
About ABC Fitness
ABC Fitness is the \#1 software provider for fitness businesses of any size, all around the world. Supporting 30K clubs, 650K coaches, 40M members, and processing more than $12B in payments every year, ABC Fitness provides scalable, data\-driven solutions to simplify club management and engage members and clients.
From personal trainers, boutique studios, and gyms, to international franchise health clubs, ABC Fitness will move your business forward through technology and industry insights. Innovation is at the center of everything we do, across ABC Glofox, ABC Ignite, ABC Trainerize, and ABC Evo. Let's make your fitness vision a seamless reality, together.
Learn more at abcfitness.com
\#LI\-REMOTE*If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over\-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!*

title: Software Engineer - NextJS [Talents Bench]
description:
Metal Toad is an award\-winning AWS Consulting Partner and AWS Managed Services provider company based in the USA. We help our customers with their cloud adoption by providing architecture, migration, optimization, machine learning, and even 24/7 support. We are a professional services firm providing services in software engineering and the cloud. We do Technical consulting, Programming \& Quality Assurance, DevOps, Applications, UX, Product management, and Project management.

  

Metal Toad is a fully remote company, offering all team members the ability to work from home. For this opportunity, the selected candidate must be available to work **Monday to Friday, from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM Pacific Time (PST).**

  


Although Metal Toad is a remote company, we are currently seeking contractors **residing in Brazil** for this position. Compensation will be made in**Brazilian Reais (R$)**, in accordance with the local currency of the country where the position is located. Due to legal limitations, **we are unable to sponsor any type of visa**.

  


To apply for this position, please submit your **resume in English as a PDF.**

 **Job description**



The NextJS Software Engineer position at Metal Toad requires experience in building high\-performing, scalable, enterprise\-grade applications. You will be part of a talented team that works on mission\-critical applications.

 **Responsibilities**



Planning


* Able to adapt to dynamic and collaborative work environments, make independent decisions and communicate them effectively.
* Confirms project requirements by reviewing program objectives, input data, and output requirements with PMs, supervisors, and clients.
* Provides estimates based on requirements, wireframes, and designs.


Development


* Own project success by proactively communicating risks, known issues, and changelogs.
* Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle.
* Work as part of a team.
* Code conforms to best practices.
* Appreciate the value of well\-tested code.

Required

title: Analista de infraestrutura - pleno (1)
description:
Descrição:
Requisitos Mínimos

* Formação: graduação completa ou cursando em Ciências da Computação, Sistemas de Informação, Redes de Computadores ou áreas correlatas.
* Experiência: com infraestrutura de TI corporativa com ambientes híbridos (on\-premises \+ cloud).
* Certificações desejáveis: Microsoft Certified (MS\-900, AZ\-104, ou equivalente), ITIL Foundation, CompTIA Network\+ ou Security\+.
* Disponibilidade: atuação presencial.

  

Conhecimentos Técnicos Desejáveis

  

* Sistemas e Plataformas: Windows Server, Linux, VMware vSphere, Microsoft 365, Azure, Active Directory, Entra ID, Exchange Online.
* Redes e Segurança: TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN, firewalls, VLANs, proxy, gestão de certificados digitais.
* Backup e Recuperação: Veeam, Networker ou soluções equivalentes.
* Monitoramento e Logs: PRTG, Grafana, Zabbix
* Gestão e Inventário: GLPI, Lansweeper, Intune, SCCM, ou ferramentas similares.
* Ferramentas de Suporte e Ticketing: GLPI, ServiceNow, Jira Service Management ou similares.
* Automação e Scripting: PowerShell, Bash, ou Python para automação de rotinas administrativas.
* Metodologias e Normas: ITIL, ISO 27001, práticas de segurança e continuidade de negócios.

  

Perfil Comportamental Esperado

  

* Postura proativa e foco em estabilidade e confiabilidade operacional.
* Capacidade analítica para diagnóstico e resolução de incidentes complexos.
* Atenção a detalhes e comprometimento com documentação e controle técnico.
* Comunicação clara e colaborativa com times de diferentes áreas.
* Capacidade de priorização sob pressão e atuação estruturada em cenários críticos.
* Comprometimento com melhoria contínua, aprendizado técnico e boas práticas.
* Administração do Microsoft 365 e Office: gestão de licenças, troubleshooting avançado, criação e manutenção de contas, políticas de segurança, integração com SharePoint, Teams, Exchange Online e demais serviços corporativos.
* Gestão de Identidades e Acessos (IAM): administração de usuários, grupos e políticas no Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) e Active Directory local, com foco em sincronização híbrida, Single Sign\-On (SSO), MFA e governança de acessos.
* Gerenciamento de Backups Corporativos: operação e monitoramento de rotinas de backup de arquivos, servidores físicos e virtuais, bancos de dados e e\-mails; execução de testes de restauração, verificação de logs e garantia de aderência às políticas de retenção e compliance.
* Atendimento de Chamados de Infraestrutura: atuação como suporte de segundo nível (N2\), triando e solucionando incidentes de hardware, software, rede e sistemas corporativos; escalonamento técnico quando necessário.
* Monitoramento Proativo: acompanhamento de alarmes e eventos em servidores, storages, redes, energia e links de comunicação; identificação de tendências e falhas potenciais; resposta e mitigação de incidentes críticos.
* Controle de Licenciamento de Software: administração e auditoria de licenças de sistemas operacionais, suítes corporativas e ferramentas de infraestrutura; gestão de prazos de renovação e compliance.
* Inventário de Ativos de TI: atualização e reconciliação contínua do inventário de hardware e software, abrangendo servidores físicos/virtuais, equipamentos de rede e dispositivos de usuários.
* Colaboração com outras áreas: apoio às equipes de desenvolvimento, dados e operações logísticas em demandas que envolvam infraestrutura, redes e integração de sistemas.
* Documentação Técnica: manutenção de procedimentos operacionais, diagramas de infraestrutura, políticas e registros de incidentes.
* Adoção de Melhores Práticas: contribuir para o fortalecimento de processos ITIL, segurança da informação e automação de tarefas operacionais.

title: Analista de Garantia da Qualidade
Data Management Analyst
description:
The Data Management Analyst oversees daily data intake and output through the Geophysical Data Network (RDG) and client site operations. The role requires leadership, governance expertise, and strong knowledge of business processes and subsurface data types, including seismic, non\-seismic, and well data. The analyst must apply innovative approaches to data management using tools like Resilio, Web Synthase, AIG, Linux scripts, and other analytical platforms, with expert understanding of their use in a corporate environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Deliver exceptional client service in all aspects of data management, including data transfer, loading, quality assurance, cleanup, and governance.
* Maintain accurate time tracking using corporate tools and ensure timely handling of billing information.
* Develop and apply effective project management practices, such as decision records and process documentation.
* Collaborate with team members to identify optimal solutions and navigate conflicting priorities effectively.
* Communicate clearly and promptly with both client personnel and Katalyst operational staff.
* Assess the current state of RDG systems and disk usage and monitor progress toward future system improvements.

**Qualifications \& Skills:**

* Deep understanding of data transfer technologies and subsurface data loading processes.
* Expert\-level knowledge of subsurface data types—including well and seismic data formats—as well as ownership, entitlements, and business tools used to access and manage this data.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Proven ability to solve complex problems effectively and efficiently.
* Collaborative mindset with a strong team orientation.
* Proficiency in key tools such as ArcGIS/QGIS, Microsoft PowerPoint, Word, and Excel.
* Experience with organizational change management practices.
* Strategic thinker with an awareness of how individual contributions impact team performance and client outcomes.

**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work:**


This is a full\-time position. As a full\-time position, the Data Management Analyst is eligible to participate in benefits coverage offered to Katalyst employees based on geographical location.


This is a full\-time position that may be performed remotely, at a Katalyst office, or on a client site. Standard working hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., with occasional evening or weekend work required to support global operations.


Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

**Required Education and Experience:**

* High school diploma or equivalent required; college degree preferred.
* 5\+ years of hands\-on experience working with oil and gas subsurface data, including related documents and file types.
* Demonstrated success in collaborative, team\-based environments.

title: DESENVOLVEDOR JR FULL-STACK
description:
Estamos em busca de um(a) Desenvolvedor(a) Júnior para integrar nosso time de tecnologia. Procuramos alguém com base técnica, vontade de aprender e disposição para atuar tanto no front\-end quanto no back\-end, contribuindo para a evolução contínua dos nossos produtos.

 **Responsabilidades e atribuições**  

* Desenvolver e manter aplicações web utilizando React no front\-end.
* Implementar APIs e serviços utilizando C\# (.NET) no back\-end.
* Criar e otimizar consultas, procedures e modelos de dados em SQL (SQL Server).
* Colaborar com o time para analisar requisitos, propor soluções e corrigir problemas.
* Versionar código utilizando Git.
* Auxiliar na criação de testes e garantir a qualidade das entregas.
* Trabalhar seguindo boas práticas de desenvolvimento (clean code, SOLID, padrões de projeto).
* Construir e manter aplicativos mobile utilizando Flutter (Dart).

  

**Requisitos e qualificações** **Front\-end (React):**

* Conhecimento em Reactjs.
* Uso de Hooks (useState, useEffect, useContext).
* Consumo de APIs REST.
* Noções de componentização, gerenciamento de estado e props.
* Conhecimento básico em HTML5, CSS3 e JavaScript ES6\+.
* Familiaridade Redux.

 **Back\-end (C\# / .NET):**

* Conhecimento em C\# e lógica de programação.
* Experiência com ASP.NET Core / .NET 6\+ para criação de APIs.
* Noções de Entity Framework (Db\-First ou Code\-First).
* Manipulação de DTOs, controllers e services.
* Compreensão de injeção de dependência.

 **Banco de Dados (SQL):**

* Experiência com SQL Server.
* Criação de queries, joins, views, procedures e functions.
* Modelagem básica de dados (tabelas, chaves, normalização).
* Conhecimento em índices e otimização simples de consultas.

 **Mobile (Flutter):**

* Conhecimento em Flutter e linguagem Dart.
* Construção de interfaces responsivas com Widgets.
* Integração com APIs REST.
* Gerenciamento de estado (Provider, Bloc ou outro).
* Noções de publicação e build para Android (e opcionalmente iOS).

  

**Informações adicionais**  

Buscamos um profissional proativo, com vontade de aprender, boa comunicação, facilidade para trabalhar em equipe, organização, atenção aos detalhes e capacidade de compreender problemas para propor soluções assertivas.

  

Modalidade: Presencial


Horário: Segunda a Sexta\-feira, das 08h00 às 18h00

 **Benefícios:**

  

* Cesta básica;
* Convênio médico;
* Convênio odontológico;
* Convênio farmácia;
* VR;
* Seguro de vida;
* Vale transporte;
* Gympass;
* Auster;
* PLR;
* Bolsa de estudos Facens;

  

O Grupo Splice, 100% nacional, se posiciona em quatro frentes estratégicas de setores da economia (Educação, Real State, Infraestrutura e Tecnologia), com investimentos maciços para continuar contribuindo, de forma efetiva, com o crescimento do nosso país. Este ano, 2021, completa 50 anos de história, um marco na nossa região, proporcionando desenvolvimento pessoal e profissional para todos à sua volta.

  

Com uma trajetória de tirar o fôlego nós superamos limites, nos reinventamos diversas vezes e mantemos o nosso legado. De pouco em pouco conquistamos corações, inovações e olha só, chegamos até aqui. Este aniversário de 50 anos reflete tudo o que vivemos juntos, e a nossa gratidão por ter você aqui.

title: ANALISTA DE SUPORTE PL
description:
**Você já conhece a \#PrimeControl?**  

A Prime Control é uma consultoria de tecnologia engajada em proteger a vida digital das empresas e das pessoas.  

Somos a empresa que mais cresceu no Brasil na categoria de pequenas e médias empresas nos últimos dois anos. Acreditamos que investir em pessoas e tecnologia é a chave para o sucesso da organização.  

Ficou na dúvida se quer vir trabalhar com a gente? Dá uma olhada no Glassdoor e veja como estamos sendo avaliados!  

  

**Como se tornar um \#PrimeHeroe?**  

Você precisa ser engajado, atualizado com as melhores práticas ágeis do mercado e que curta resolver problemas complexos. Que tenha um olhar investigativo e criatividade para propor soluções de problemas não convencionais.  

Também procuramos alguém que goste de aprender, que seja proativo e autogerenciável. Que entenda a importância de entregar com qualidade e que faça uso das boas práticas. Disso não abrimos mão! Aqui todo herói é igual. Todos os desafios são destinados aos PCDs também!


**Quais serão as batalhas que enfrentará?** **️**


Estamos em busca de um **Analista Júnior** dedicado e proativo para atuar no coração da nossa **Engenharia de Qualidade**.


Você será o responsável por garantir a estabilidade e a alta disponibilidade do nosso **Lab Mobile (Device Farm)**, um ambiente crucial que hospeda dispositivos Android e iOS para testes de software em grande escala.


Se você tem paixão por tecnologia, gosta de resolver problemas e quer iniciar sua carreira dando suporte a grandes projetos de automação, esta vaga é para você!


**Responsabilidades e Rotinas:**


O profissional será responsável por manter a excelência operacional do nosso ambiente de monitoração:


* **Manutenção e Disponibilidade (24/7\):** Monitorar ativamente os **servidores** e logs do ambiente para garantir que os dispositivos estejam sempre online e disponíveis para testes.
* **Suporte Técnico de Devices:** Atuar na linha de frente para resolver indisponibilidades, aplicando correções como desativar e reativar o modo de depuração para restaurar o acesso aos dispositivos.  

Experiência com acesso remoto por meio de TeamViewer e VNC
* **Gestão de Estoque e Hardware:** Auxiliar na organização e controle do inventário de dispositivos, participando do processo de solicitação de novos equipamentos ou substituições (garantindo o cumprimento do limite contratual).
* **Garantia da Qualidade de Dados:** Assegurar o preenchimento preciso e detalhado das planilhas de gestão e relatórios de status do ambiente, fundamental para a rastreabilidade e comunicação da equipe.

**Requisitos Mínimos:**


* Formação (ou cursando) em áreas de Tecnologia da Informação, Ciência da Computação, Análise de Sistemas ou afins.
* Ter o básico de Word e excel, PPT, Teams e outlook
* Conhecimento básico em conceitos de **Qualidade de Software (QA)** e ciclo de vida de desenvolvimento (SDLC).
* Familiaridade com ambientes de testes (Homologação, QA) e conceitos de sistemas operacionais mobile (Android e iOS).
* Capacidade de organização e alto senso de responsabilidade, urgência e pontualidade.

**Diferenciais (Não Obrigatórios):**


* Experiência prévia em monitoramento de ambientes ou infraestrutura.
* Conhecimento básico em ferramentas de automação (como Appium, Selenium) ou metodologias Ágeis (Scrum/Kanban).
* Proatividade na solução de problemas técnicos.  

Experiência com ferramentas de monitoramento como Zabbix, Grafana e Telegraf

**E aí, deu match? Junte\-se ao nosso time de experts em qualidade digital e venha construir a maior empresa de tecnologia do país! ✈️**

title: TÉCNICO(A) DE SERVIÇOS I - SÃO PAULO OESTE
description:
Date Posted:
2025\-06\-24
Country:
Brazil
Location:
LOC6012: Rua Guarau, 54, Andar 3, Mirandopolis, São Paulo, São Paulo, CEP 04\.052\-000 Brazil
Vaga: Técnico(a) de Serviços I  

  

Horário e Local de Trabalho: De segunda\-feira a sábado, das 8h às 16h20, em São Paulo (SP)  

  

A importância do seu papel em nossa equipe:  

Quem mora em uma grande cidade sabe o quanto é desafiador ficar com um elevador fora de serviço. Por isso, seu trabalho é de extrema importância para manter em movimento clientes e passageiros que confiam na Otis.  

  

Habilidades que você colocará em prática:  

* Executar manutenções preventivas, corretivas e reparos em elevadores Otis e de outras marcas
* Antecipar possíveis cenários técnicos, elaborar diagnósticos e propor soluções
* Interagir com nossos clientes, colocando as necessidades deles em primeiro lugar

  

Quem procuramos?  

* Profissional com Ensino Médio completo e formação técnica em Mecânica, Mecatrônica, Elétrica e Eletrônica
* Conhecimentos em segurança e formação em NR10 e NR35
* Experiência com manutenção e atendimento em serviços de elevadores e escadas rolantes conta como diferencial

  

Por que se juntar à Otis?  

Você vai fazer parte da empresa que mais move pessoas no mundo, junto com uma equipe respeitada e com capacidade de desenvolver, construir e ter sucesso por gerações. Saiba mais sobre a Otis em https://www.otis.com/pt/br/carreiras.  

  

Esperamos você para elevar sua carreira conosco!  

\#BuildWhatsNext \#OrgulhoDeSerOtis.
If you live in a city, chances are we will give you a lift or play a role in keeping you moving every day.
Otis is the world’s leading elevator and escalator manufacturing, installation, and service company. We move 2\.4 billion people every day and maintain approximately 2\.4 million customer units worldwide, the industry's largest Service portfolio.
You may recognize our products in some of the world’s most famous landmarks including the Eiffel Tower, Empire State Building, Burj Khalifa and the Petronas Twin Towers! We are 72,000 people strong, including engineers, digital technology experts, sales, and functional specialists, as well as factory and field technicians, all committed to meeting the diverse needs of our customers and passengers in more than 200 countries and territories worldwide. We are proud to be a diverse, global team with a proven legacy of innovation that continues to be the bedrock of a fast\-moving, high\-performance company.
When you join Otis, you become part of an innovative global industry leader with a resilient business model. You’ll belong to a diverse, trusted, and caring community where your contributions, and the skills and capabilities you’ll gain working alongside the best and brightest, keep us connected and on the cutting edge.
We provide opportunities, training, and resources, that build leadership and capabilities in Sales, Field, Engineering and Major Projects and our Employee Scholar Program is a notable point of pride, through which Otis sponsors colleagues to pursue degrees or certification programs.
Today, our focus more than ever is on people. As a global, people\-powered company, we put people – passengers, customers, and colleagues – at the center of everything we do. We are guided by our values that we call our Three Absolutes – prioritizing Safety, Ethics, Quality in all that we do. If you would like to learn more about environmental, social and governance (ESG) at Otis click here.
Become a part of the Otis team and help us \#Buildwhatsnext!*Otis is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other protected class according to applicable law. To request an accommodation in completing an employment application due to a special need or a disability, please contact us at careers@otis.com.*

title: Engenheiro de Inteligência Artificial Sênior
description:
A combinarIntegral

**Sobre o projeto**



Estamos desenvolvendo um CRM mobile em Flutter voltado à força de vendas, com recursos inteligentes que otimizam a rotina dos usuários — como resumos automáticos de dados, transcrição de áudio e geração de insights estratégicos.



A aplicação já possui integração com OpenAI e Google Gemini, e conta com um módulo próprio de IA criado em Python e integrado ao app via APIs.  

Agora buscamos um profissional para evoluir a camada de IA, trazendo escalabilidade, novas capacidades cognitivas e melhores práticas de engenharia.


**Objetivo do cargo**



Elevar a maturidade da camada de IA do CRM, transformando\-a de uma integração funcional em uma plataforma inteligente escalável e confiável, capaz de gerar valor real ao time de vendas por meio de automação, insights e personalização.

  

**Responsabilidades**


* Projetar, desenvolver e otimizar pipelines de IA integrados ao back\-end da aplicação (Python).
* Evoluir a implementação atual de RAG (Retrieval\-Augmented Generation), melhorando embeddings, consultas contextuais e performance.
* Criar e orquestrar agentes inteligentes capazes de realizar tarefas contextuais dentro do CRM (ex: sumarizações, sugestões, insights preditivos).
* Contribuir com a engenharia de prompt, definindo templates, parametrizações e boas práticas para diferentes fluxos da aplicação.
* Apoiar o líder técnico Flutter na integração entre o módulo de IA e o app mobile (via APIs REST ou WebSocket).
* Automatizar o versionamento, monitoramento e testes de modelos/pipelines (MLOps).
* Documentar o ecossistema de IA da aplicação e apoiar a equipe de desenvolvimento na adoção de boas práticas.
* Pesquisar e validar novas ferramentas, APIs e modelos que possam agregar valor ao produto (LLMs, embeddings, frameworks).
  


**Requisitos Técnicos**


* Experiência sólida em Python, especialmente com frameworks de IA como LangChain, LlamaIndex, FastAPI, Pydantic, Celery ou similares.
* Domínio prático de integrações com LLMs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic, etc.).
* Conhecimento em vetorização e banco de vetores (FAISS, Pinecone, ChromaDB, Milvus, etc.).
* Experiência com pipelines RAG e técnicas de recuperação de contexto.
* Noções de engenharia de prompt e criação de agentes (LangGraph, CrewAI, Semantic Kernel, etc.).
* Experiência em integração de IA com sistemas web ou mobile.
* Conhecimento de MLOps básico (versionamento de modelos, testes, automação e deploy).
* Experiência com serviços em nuvem (AWS, GCP ou Azure) e containers (Docker, Kubernetes).

  

  

**Diferenciais**


* Experiência com aplicações mobile Flutter e integração com back\-end Python.
* Experiência com processamento de áudio (Speech\-to\-Text) e sumarização de texto.
* Conhecimento em LLMs open source (LLaMA, Mistral, Phi\-3, etc.).
* Vivência em squads ágeis e trabalho colaborativo com líderes técnicos e designers de produto.
* Interesse em experimentação, métricas de performance de IA e aprendizado contínuo.


**Perfil Comportamental**


* Perfil curioso e proativo, que busca entender o contexto do negócio antes de aplicar tecnologia.
* Capacidade de colaboração técnica com diferentes áreas (mobile, backend, UX, produto).
* Disposição para trazer soluções criativas e sustentáveis, sem comprometer qualidade.
* Habilidade em documentar, compartilhar conhecimento e mentorar desenvolvedores em IA aplicada.
* Foco em entregas consistentes e mensuráveis, alinhadas ao roadmap do produto.


**Modelo de atuação**


* Squad multidisciplinar (Flutter, Design, Produto, Backend, QA e IA).
* Atuação remota ou híbrida, com rituais ágeis (daily, review, retrospectiva).
* Reporta\-se ao líder técnico Flutter e gestor do projeto e colabora com o gestor de produto na priorização de iniciativas inteligentes.

**Exigências**

* Ensino Superior

title: Analista de quality assurance (qa) sr
description:
**Descrição:**  

Requisitos Essenciais
  
  

Experiência prévia na área de Quality Assurance e formação superior completa em tecnologia.
  
  

Conhecimento e prática com frameworks de automação de testes, especialmente com Playwright.
  
  

Vivência em metodologias ágeis, como Scrum e Kanban.
  
  

Boa comunicação e habilidade para trabalho colaborativo.
  
  

Experiência com testes end\-to\-end (E2E) e testes de integração.
  
  

Conhecimento em testes de APIs com Postman, SOAPUI ou ferramentas similares.
  
  

Habilidade em realizar consultas básicas no banco de dados utilizando PL/SQL Developer.
  
  

Requisitos Desejáveis
  
  

Conhecimento em linguagens de programação como JavaScript, Java ou TypeScript.
  
  

Experiência adicional com outras ferramentas de automação de testes.
  
  

Procuramos pessoas que queiram fazer parte da transformação e evolução dos nossos negócios digitais, atuando em modelo de squad multidisciplinar, que acredita que para criar um ambiente inovador é imprescindível que não tenham medo de errar e de arriscar! Que se identifique com um time que valoriza a colaboração e a aprendizagem contínua.
  
  

Eae, quer vir fazer parte disso e voar com a gente???
  
  

Então, veja abaixo mais detalhes dos desafios que temos para você e o que você precisará possuir de conhecimento para fazer parte disso!
  
  

Realizar testes manuais, exploratórios e de regressão.
  
  

Documentar e reportar bugs e incidentes de forma clara, facilitando a resolução pela equipe de desenvolvimento.
  
  

Analisar os resultados dos testes, avaliando o impacto das falhas na usabilidade da plataforma e contribuindo com feedbacks úteis.
  
  

Participar de reuniões e rituais ágeis, colaborando com desenvolvedores e stakeholders para garantir a qualidade do produto.
  
  

Revisar requisitos de software e documentos técnicos, assegurando a cobertura de testes e identificando possíveis riscos ou falhas.
  
  

Desenvolver e manter testes automatizados com Playwright, garantindo a cobertura de novas funcionalidades e a atualização dos testes existentes.

title: Senior Data Engineer | Deep Individual Data team
description:
**Your wellbeing, our mission. Join a company shaping a healthier world.**


**GET TO KNOW US**



At Wellhub we're revolutionizing workplace wellness. Our platform connects employees worldwide to the best partners for fitness, mindfulness, therapy, nutrition, and sleep—all in one simple subscription. Headquartered in NYC with team members in 11 countries, we're on a mission to make every company a wellness company.  

We believe work should be fulfilling, inspiring, and balanced. Here, you'll find a team that values wellbeing, collaboration, and different perspectives, where passion and creativity push boundaries to create real impact. Your contributions will help shape a healthier, more balanced world for you and millions of people globally.  

Join us in redefining the future of wellbeing!  

  

**THE OPPORTUNITY**



We are hiring a **Senior Data Enginee**r for our **CARE \- Deep Individual Data team** in Brazil! This is a **Remote – Brazil** position, meaning you can work from anywhere within the country. Please note that this role is only open to candidates in **Brazil.**

  


Join our growing CARE (Coach on Artificial Intelligence for Real Engagement) team at Wellhub and help us build the next generation of AI\-powered solutions. This role focuses on organizing and leveraging digital information about users and people to enhance user experience and recommendations.  

This project involves collecting user data from various sources in multiple formats (photo, video, text, audio). You will be instrumental in processing, analyzing, and utilizing this data to improve the user experience, user recommendations, business insights, and overall platform quality. Such candidates must be avid learners and be prepared to learn quickly.  

We use data and software engineering principles to solve large\-scale production challenges. Our infrastructure is completely in the cloud, running many more cutting\-edge projects.

  


**YOUR IMPACT**


* You will develop and maintain data models and structures that enable efficient querying and analysis;
* You will design, develop, and maintain data pipelines to transform and process large volumes of data from various sources, while adding business context and semantics to the data;
* You will implement automated data quality checks to guarantee data quality and consistency across the whole data life cycle.
* Live the mission: inspire and empower others by genuinely caring for your own wellbeing and your colleagues. Bring wellbeing to the forefront of work, and create a supportive environment where everyone feels comfortable taking care of themselves, taking time off, and finding work\-life balance.

  


**WHO YOU ARE**


* You have created robust and scalable data models from business requirements
* You have worked collaboratively to collect, prepare and analyze complex business data
* You can engage engineering and product teams to elicit requirements and present solutions to top management
* Knowledge of data pipeline tools and technologies (e.g., Airflow, EMR, Kafka).
* You can collaborate with different teams to understand data needs and develop effective data pipelines
* You are comfortable understanding big data concepts to ingest, process, and make data available for data scientists, business analysts, and product teams
* You are comfortable maintaining data consistency across the entire data ecosystem
* You are motivated to contribute to a data\-driven culture and see the impact of your work reflected company\-wide
  


We recognize that individuals approach job applications differently. We strongly encourage all aspiring applicants to go for it, even if they don't match the job description 100%. We welcome your application and will be delighted to explore if you could be a great fit for our team. For this specific role, please note that prior experience in Data Modeling and Data Pipelines is a mandatory requirement.

  



**WHAT WE OFFER YOU**



With thoughtful benefits, emotional wellbeing resources, and a culture that empowers you to take ownership of your role and your wellbeing, we create an environment where you can thrive in all dimensions of your life.  

Our flexible benefits program allows you to customize some of the benefits, according to your needs!


**Our benefits include:**


**WELLHUB:** Free Gold\+ membership with access to onsite gyms and studios, digital fitness programs, and online wellness resources for meditation, nutrition, mental wellbeing support, and more! Add up to three family members to your plan, ensuring access to wellness for those who matter most to you


**WELLZ:** A complete emotional wellbeing program with a unique approach. It offers personalized journeys that combine individual therapy sessions (52 per year) and on\-demand content.


**HEALTHCARE:** Health, dental, and life insurance.


**FLEXIBLE WORK:** As a Flexible First company, we offer hybrid and remote options to give you the freedom to work in a way that suits you. The model for this specific role can be discussed with your recruiter and hiring manager. When you join, use our home office reimbursement to set up your home office


**FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE:** Flexibility for us isn't just about where we work—it also means being able to shape how and when we get things done. Together with their leaders, employees define schedules that align with their time zones, team needs, and personal routines.


**PAID TIME OFF:** It's important to take time away from work to recharge. Employees receive vacations after 6 months and additional 3 days off per year \+ 1 day off for each year of tenure (up to 5 additional days) \+ an extra holiday for your birthday!


**PAID PARENTAL LEAVE:** Welcoming a new child is one of the most special moments in your life. Take the time to be present and enjoy your growing family. We offer 100% paid parental leave to all new parents. Parents giving birth are eligible for an extended leave and a ramp\- back period to return part\-time while they get settled.


**CAREER GROWTH:** Access world\-class platforms, participate in interactive sessions, build your personalized development roadmap, and explore internal opportunities. We focus on continuous learning and feedback to support your journey toward personal and professional success.


**CULTURE:** You'll join a team of passionate people who come together to break boundaries, support each other, and create a meaningful impact in workplace wellness. We win together, building trust through open communication and a culture where every perspective matters. Learn more about our shared culture and values here.


**PAID PARENTAL LEAVE:** Welcoming a new child is one of the most special moments in your life and we want our employees to take the time to be present and enjoy their growing family. We offer 100% paid parental leave to all new parents and extended maternity leave.


**CAREER GROWTH:** Outstanding opportunities for personal and career growth. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development.


**CULTURE:** You'll join a team of passionate people who come together to break boundaries, support each other, and create a meaningful impact in workplace wellness. We win together, building trust through open communication and a culture where every perspective matters. Learn more about our shared culture and values here.


**And to get a glimpse of life at Wellhub… Follow us on** **Instagram** **@lifeatwellhub** **and** **LinkedIn****!**

  


**Diversity, Equity, and Belonging at Wellhub**



We aim to create a collaborative, supportive, and inclusive space where everyone knows they belong.



Wellhub is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, non\-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.



Questions on how we treat your personal data? See our Aviso de Privacidade para Candidatos.

title: Assistente Técnico (Rastreamento Veicular)
Senior SDET
description:
### **Description**

  

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.
Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including H\&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale’s, use Tabby’s technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores.  

Tabby generates over $10 billion in annual transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest\-rated, most\-reviewed, largest, and fastest\-growing FinTech in the GCC region.
Tabby launched in 2019 and has since raised \+$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors, and is now valued at $4\.3 billion.
  

We are seeking a highly skilled **Senior** **SDET** to join our team. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and managing testing tools, conducting problem analysis, and providing leadership in improving quality assurance processes. This role requires a deep understanding of automation, tool creation, and team management, as well as the ability to work hands\-on with code and infrastructure.### **Key Responsibilities:**

  

* Create and maintain testing tools to enhance the efficiency of our quality assurance processes.
* Lead the development and implementation of automation frameworks and scripts, with a focus on Go (Golang).
* Research and troubleshoot issues in the system, providing solutions to improve performance and stability.
* Assist colleagues from other teams, providing technical guidance and support, and reviewing merge requests from peers.
* Work on improving continuous integration and delivery pipelines, ensuring smooth deployment of code.
* Serve as a thought leader within the team, managing QA processes, overseeing automation efforts, and driving improvements in tooling and practices.
* Respond to requests from colleagues, troubleshoot issues, and ensure quality across different services and teams.

  

### **What you’ll bring:**

  

* Proven experience as a QA Lead, Automation Engineer, or SDET, with a track record of managing quality processes and leading test automation initiatives.
* Strong proficiency in Go (Golang) for both automation and service development.
* Hands\-on experience with building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines.
* Ability to manage, analyze, and improve QA direction, including identifying and eliminating inefficient tools and practices.
* Experience with monitoring, alerting systems, and fixing issues in production environments.
* Solid knowledge of test frameworks and the ability to write testing tools from scratch.
* Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work with cross\-functional teams and help solve problems beyond QA.

  

### **What we offer:**

  

* Full\-time B2B contract
* Fully remote setup, work from anywhere in Europe
* Up to 20% tax allowance
* 22 paid leave days annually
* Stock options (ESOP) in a fast\-scaling, pre\-IPO company
* Flexi benefits you can use for wellness, travel, or learning

Work alongside a high\-performing, international engineering team in a global fintech unicorn  
* 

Relocation support is available to our hubs in Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, and Spain, including flights, temporary accommodation, and legal setup.### **About Tabby**


Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save, by reshaping their relationship with money.  

  

The company’s flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in\-store with no interest or fees. Over 32,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA and Shein use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.  

  

Tabby has generated over $7 billion in transaction volume for its partner brands and has the highest rated, most reviewed, largest and fastest growing app of any fintech in the GCC region.  

  

Tabby launched operations in 2020 and has raised \+$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors.

title: Coordenador de Manutenção e Engenharia
description:
**Junte\-se à Oterra na criação de alimentos e bebidas naturais, para um mundo sustentável e saudável.**

Com sede na Dinamarca, e unidades de produção na Europa, América Latina e nos EUA, somos uma equipe apaixonada com mais de 1400 colaboradores de 48 nacionalidades em 27 países ao redor do mundo, atendendo a 120 mercados globalmente. Como líder mundial no fornecimento de cores naturais, oferecemos aos fabricantes de alimentos e bebidas uma alternativa às cores artificiais. Alimentação e saúde estão no coração de tudo o que fazemos, e todos os dias mais de 400 milhões de pessoas consomem um produto com as nossas cores. Acreditamos que a natureza acertou na primeira vez.
**Conheça sua nova equipe!**

Estamos à procura de um(a) **Coordenador de Manutenção e Engenharia** para se juntar à nossa equipe em crescimento. Baseado em nossa planta em **Valinhos/SP**, você se juntará a uma equipe dedicada.
**Como será o seu papel?**

Será responsável pela gestão do time de manutenção e engenharia, definindo estratégias da área, planejamento do plano de manutenção. Também é responsável pela gestão dos projetos de Capex, levantando as melhores condições e estratégias para empresa. Coordena os projetos de engenharia, compreendendo o levantamento das necessidades de materiais e mão de obra, análise de viabilidade e acompanhamento de cronograma e orçamentos.
**Funções e responsabilidades:**
* Será responsável pela manutenção industrial e predial preventiva e corretiva, coordenar a equipe, realizar o controle e apresentação de custos com manutenção, reduzir a perda de matéria prima do produto, evita acidentes pessoais, patrimoniais e ecológicos, aprimora equipamentos, planejar e controlar as atividades de manutenção.
* Desenvolver planos de manutenção preventiva, corretiva e preditiva, controlar os indicadores de desempenho e custos da operação de manutenção, elaborar relatórios gerenciais, promover;
* Coordena os projetos de engenharia, compreendendo o levantamento das necessidades de materiais e mão de obra, análise de viabilidade e acompanhamento de cronograma e orçamentos.
* Elaborar e controlar o orçamento para manutenção e projetos de engenharia, garantindo a alocação eficiente dos recursos financeiros.
* Negociar e gerenciar contratos com fornecedores e prestadores de serviços externos relacionados a manutenção e engenharia.
* Assegurar que todas as atividades de manutenção e engenharia estejam em conformidade com normas regulatórias e padrões de segurança, entre outras atividades relacionadas.


**Quem estamos procurando?**

O candidato ideal é dinâmico, e com habilidade para resolução de problemas e flexibilidade.
**Experiência e habilidades necessárias**
* Escolaridade Minima: Superior Completo em Engenharia (mecânica, /produção/afins)
* Liderar as Pessoas com Inteligência Emocional
* Foco no desenvolvimento, coesão e autonomia do time
* Capacidade de comunicação e trânsito nas demais áreas da empresa (EHS/Produção/QA)
* Capacidade de visão global da cadeia/negócio
* Inglês Avançado.


**O que podemos oferecer?**

Oferecemos uma oportunidade empolgante em uma organização ambiciosa, onde o compromisso é forte e onde trabalhamos com o propósito de melhorar nossos processos e resultados. Temos um ambiente informal e valorizamos muito o trabalho em equipe, colaboração e transparência.

Pacote de compensação competitivo  


**Informações adicionais e inscrição**

Adoraríamos saber mais sobre você e sua motivação para esta vaga! Envie\-nos seu CV em inglês.

Por favor, note que estaremos trabalhando com um processo de seleção contínuo, o que significa que poderemos encerrar o processo de inscrição antes do previsto, caso encontremos os candidatos certos. Então, não demore, envie sua candidatura hoje mesmo!
